      • Product

        public Product(TypeOfProduct t,
               Brand b,
               int u,
               boolean g,
               java.lang.String m,
               double p,
               java.lang.String c)
        This is the constructor of the class.
        name: Product
        pre: the variables t, b, u, g, m, p and c are already initialized.
        post: All the attributes of the class were initialized.
        Parameters:
        t - Is a TypeOfProduct object that contains the type of product related with a product. t!=null.
        b - Is a Brand object that contains the brand of a product. b!=null.
        u - Is an integer variable that contains the number of available units of a product. u!=0.
        g - Is a boolean variable that indicates if a product has guarantee or not.
        m - Is a String variable that contains the model of a product. m!=null and m!="".
        p - Is a double variable that contains the price of a product. p is greater than 0.
        c - Is a String variable that contains the code of a product. c!=null, c!="".

      • calculateIVA

        public double calculateIVA()
        This method returns the IVA tax of a product if its type is ElectronicEquipment and its price is greater than 783000.
        name: calculateIVA
        post: the IVA tax of a product of an ElectronicEquipment type has been gotten.
        Specified by:
        calculateIVA in interface taxIVA
        Returns:
        an double specifying iva, the IVA tax of a product of an ElectronicEquipment type.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Product p)
        This method compares the type of product and brand of two products.
        name: compareTo
        post: the products have been compared.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Product>
        Parameters:
        p - Is a Product object that references the product that wants to be compared. p!=null
        Returns:
        an integer a variable that indicates if the type of product and brand of the product is greater than the other, equal, or less.
